text: Rusk Holm is a small island in the Orkney Islands, near Faray to the west. ==History== There is a prehistoric cairn on itHaswell-Smith, Hamish. (2004) The Scottish Islands. Edinburgh. Canongate. . Rusk Holm is also home to "Holmie Sheep", which are similar to the North Ronaldsay sheep. ==Geography and geology== Corn Holm is made up of red sandstone. It is in Rapness Sound. ==References== Category:Uninhabited islands of Orkney
title: Rusk Holm
